body: After I put away my phone, I looked up to observe the cramped landscape of books before me, framed by the backdrop of a massive window. The outside was black enough to see my own distant reflection, but I could just barely see the brightly-lit concrete path that students normally took when they wanted to go back to the <CHOICE(A)> This time of the year, dresses and shorts were appropriate even after the sun set.

Inside, where my fingers sat lifelessly beside my ancient laptop, the normal old-book smell I was used to was replaced by whatever the employees of the newly-placed <CHOICE(B)> were burning. Steamed milk, maybe. It was going to drive me crazy.
